definitions.definition: A gift beyond what is actually due; an addition or superfluity .
An a fortiori occurrence, as a result of another effort without significant additional effort.
examples: Finally getting that cracked window fixed was a nice corollary of redoing the whole storefront.

definitions.definition: A proposition which follows easily from the statement or proof of another proposition.
examples: We have proven that this set is finite and well ordered; as a corollary , we now know that there is an order-preserving map from it to the natural numbers.

main_definition: A gift beyond what is actually due; an addition or superfluity .
secondary_definitions: An a fortiori occurrence, as a result of another effort without significant additional effort.
( mathematics , logic ) A proposition which follows easily from the statement or proof of another proposition.
